185761208.review:
The Ultimate Drone Simulator for Learning FPV

As someone completely new to FPV drone flying, I can confidently say that Liftoff has been a game-changer for me. Before using this simulator, I couldn’t even control a drone, but after putting in 11 hours of practice, I’ve made noticeable progress. While I’m still far from being smooth or confident like the pros, at least now I can handle basic flying, and that’s a big win for me.

What I love most about Liftoff is that it lets you practice endlessly without worrying about crashing an actual drone—which could be very expensive. The physics and realism in this simulator are outstanding. It accurately replicates the challenges of flying a real FPV drone, from wind resistance to precise controls, making it an invaluable tool for beginners like me.

Another thing I appreciate is the flexibility to practice anywhere, as it runs perfectly on a laptop. Whether you’re at home, at a coffee shop, or traveling, you can always open Liftoff and get some valuable practice in. The structured training modes help you build your skills step by step without feeling overwhelmed, keeping you motivated to improve.

If you’re looking to get into FPV flying or want to hone your skills without risking damage to a real drone, I highly recommend Liftoff. It’s a fantastic way to learn, save money, and enjoy the thrill of flying drones—anytime, anywhere.
185761208.developer_response: A project like this is only possible thanks to the support of our lovely community. Thank you for being a part of this!

185713663.review: 拟真性好，画质好，飞机自定义程度高

185652229.review:
"Liftoff" is a gripping narrative that chronicles the development of SpaceX, the pioneering private space exploration company founded by Elon Musk. Written by Eric Berger, the book offers a comprehensive and in-depth look at the company's rise, its groundbreaking achievements, and the challenges it overcame to become one of the most significant players in the space industry.

The story begins with the early days of SpaceX, focusing on the vision of Elon Musk, his ambition to revolutionize space travel, and the hurdles he faced in securing funding and support. The narrative highlights Musk's unyielding determination, his willingness to take risks, and his unconventional approach to solving complex engineering problems. The author skillfully weaves together the technical aspects of the space missions, the struggles faced by the team, and the human stories behind the achievements.

One of the most compelling aspects of "Liftoff" is its attention to detail. Berger delves into the technical challenges of designing rockets and spacecraft, providing readers with an understanding of the complexities involved in the space industry. The book also highlights the significant role of SpaceX employees, engineers, and executives who played crucial roles in making Musk's vision a reality.

In addition to the technical aspects, the book also explores the personal dynamics within SpaceX and the relationships between Musk and his team. It portrays the high-pressure environment at the company, where the stakes were incredibly high, and the demands on employees were intense. The narrative offers insight into Musk's leadership style, which can be both inspiring and challenging for those who work with him.

"Liftoff" also captures the pivotal moments in SpaceX's history, such as the first successful launch of the Falcon 1 rocket, the development and eventual success of the Falcon 9, and the company's eventual victory in securing contracts with NASA. These milestones are portrayed not just as technical achievements but as symbols of SpaceX's resilience and ability to overcome adversity.

Overall, "Liftoff" is a fascinating and engaging account of one of the most revolutionary companies in modern history. It provides an insightful look at the challenges, triumphs, and personalities behind SpaceX’s rise to prominence. For those interested in space exploration, entrepreneurship, or the journey of innovation, the book offers a compelling and thought-provoking read.

185569246.developer_response:
Liftoff is a genuine drone simulator, not Mario Kart with propellers. The drones in Liftoff require precise control across two full-range sticks, just like the real thing. The notion that you could realistically pilot a drone with just forward, backward, left, and right keys is impossible. No serious simulator operates that way, that's a complete fabrication. But hey, maybe aviation got it wrong for the past hundred years, and all we needed was a few arrow keys. Genius

I can respect critical feedback about our features, content, or physics, but giving us a negative review because you think you should be able to pilot a drone with 4 buttons is just absurd.

Adding a drone involves collaboration with the manufacturer. If any manufacturer is interested in working with us, they are welcome to reach out!

185468861.review:
This is my first drone game. Keep in mind that I don't have a drone controller; I use an Xbox controller, so my impressions may not be exactly the same as for someone who uses a drone controller.
I can tell, though, that driving a drone requires skill—a lot of it. Overcoming the difficulty, however, is extremely fun, and I'm enjoying this game a lot. I would compare it in terms of difficulty to juggling while racing through a path that involves many turns, but the feeling is more like an endless drop in which you have to perform many precise maneuvers to drop just right. The game has a good variation of fields to train the different skills for drone racing. There are fields that focus on precise maneuvers with slight turning, others that require sharp turns with many ups and downs, and others with huge open spaces that don't demand too much precision. Then there are those that are extremely challenging, with turns I still don't have the skills to master.

The graphics of the game are also really good there's a good varaiety of maps . Even with the worst settings, I still enjoy the landscapes. I especially like the sulfur map. I was really happy, I could throw myself into the volcano when I got too frustrated because of my failures.

It feels like the game could benefit from some sort of training program, which gives you exercises that ramp up in difficulty. Also, better default Xbox controller settings would be great—it took me a while to find something manageable. If i didn't know better I would have quit on the game due to that. That being said customer support was really good for me.

185461471.review: Great game fun on it's own but really helps when learning to fly FPV

This sim is addicting and I still can't do basic manuvers but I learn a little bit every few hours of stick time. Racked up 30 hours and crashed at least 4000 times if not more!!!!! Hoping to aquire at least 400 hrs before trying the real thing or at least build a little confidence. Great graphics and variety of games and highly recommended!

Si vous débutez, commencez par faire des sessions de vol libre sur des maps assez vastes pour comprendre le comportement du drone (essayez en plusieurs puis gardez en un, c'est plus simple pour la suite) puis entraînez vous sur des maps avec des obstacles (bando city etc).

184739127.review:
Having been a complete beginner 2 times, first one transitioning successfully to a real 5" and second one these days after almost 7-8 years of not touching anything, i can confidently say that learning in the OG Lift-Off is the best way to get your FPV up to a pretty decent level.

Sure there are other sims around on steam, but these are going to be harder to learn on as a first timer.
After your first free flights go straight to race with gates at straw bale, and stay there until you are decent at throttle management and turns.
IT'S GOING TO BE A STRUGGLE at first , but the benefits are absolutely worth it.

Obstacles are pretty forgiving, in the sense that your drone will pretty much go through foliage and all the LIGHT crap around you without too much hassle, and the bounces on solid objects are pretty much always recoverable when you start developing skill; and this is is another benefit that gives you much more sticks time, instead than leaving you miserable swearing on the ground or under some foliage shit that is hard as bricks.

Bind reset on your REAL RADIO, i wholeheartedly suggest to avoid gamepads like the plague, then bind turtle mode and go to practice. 
Never tried Velocidrone, as some people tend to have very good opinions about it, but here on the convenience of steam and steam remote play, when it comes to LEARNING, OG-LiftOff is KING in my opinion.

Then yes, when you get to a decent level, get also LiftOff Micro Drones and Uncrashed. 
Amazing sims with different traits that in my opinion are more suited to already decent pilots.

EDIT 08/01/25
Bought Velocidrone and honestly i wish i dind't for that price, just get this and Liftoff Microdrones.
Micros and Woops , physics-wise, feel much more like the real ones in Liftoff Micro Drones than in Velocidrone.
 I would say LO Micro Drones flies almost 1:1 specially in 65 class.
https://store.steampowered.com/app/1432320/Liftoff_Micro_Drones/ 
 5" quads are certainly very good in VD, but honestly that software looks super old and it's not fun to fly.
Lift-off is just a better and funnier package all around, and these guys are not even on Steam.
Just Get the Lift-off series and Uncrashed and you are fine TBH.

184730557.review:
Everything is great. UI, drones, simulation, maps (there could be more tho), graphics (ok), etc.

But this simulator lacks serious optimization. 64GB ram, AMD Ryzen 7 5800x octacore 3,8GHz, RTX 3070 (144hz 2560 x 1440 display) and playing it at maximum settings, the game lags. I even got a message that I need to lower the graphics or get a better system. Is this serious? Did developers forgot how to optimize games?
184730557.developer_response: Your system should be perfectly capable of running Liftoff, and as a 10 year old project Liftoff is hardly demanding for most gaming systems. We suspect something weird is going on, but without knowing any details it might be hard to pinpoint exactly what.

184469577.review:
This is the most comprehensive drone sim on the market right now.  It does tutorials, free flight, stunts and racing, and does them all well.  Some drone sims are better in one category, but none have a complete package like Liftoff, at least not right now.  A flight controller like the Radiomaster Boxer or Pocket is needed, normal game controllers won't work.

If you have any interest in drones, Liftoff is worth it.

Other sims:
- DRL and DCL have a more video-gamey experience
- FPV Logic has good stunting through abandoned factories
- Velocidrone (not on Steam) is good for racing training
- Uncrashed is popular, so far I like Liftoff more
- Liftoff Micro Drones is a separate game for Tiny Whoops (micro drones)

183553913.review: go to buy a dlc they take my money and don't add the dlc... rip off
183553913.developer_response:
If you bought the DLC I'm a 100% confident you have it. You simply need to download and select it.

- have you downloaded the DLC after buying it?
- have you activated the DLC (should be by default)
- have you selected the DLC content in the level selection?
